official-title.#text:
To amend the Naval Petroleum Reserves Production Act of
		  1976 to direct the Secretary of the Interior to conduct an expeditious program
		  of competitive leasing of oil and gas in the National Petroleum Reserve in
		  Alaska, including at least one lease sale in the Reserve each year in the
		  period 2013 through 2023, and for other purposes.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text:
National Petroleum Reserve Alaska
			 Access Act

text.#text: This bill shall be called the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: that—

text.#text: It is the sense of

header.#text:
Sense of Congress
			 and reaffirming national policy for the National Petroleum Reserve in
			 Alaska

text.#text:
the National
			 Petroleum Reserve in Alaska remains explicitly designated, both in name and
			 legal status, for purposes of providing oil and natural gas resources to the
			 United States; and

accordingly, the national policy is to
			 actively advance oil and gas development within the Reserve by facilitating the
			 expeditious exploration, production, and transportation of oil and natural gas
			 from and through the Reserve.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended to read as
			 follows:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 107(a) of the Naval Petroleum
			 Reserves Production Act of 1976
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Naval Petroleum Reserves Production Act of 1976/s:107/ss:a

header.#text:
National
			 Petroleum Reserve in Alaska: lease sales

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall
				conduct an expeditious program of competitive leasing of oil and gas in the
				reserve in accordance with this Act. Such program shall include at least one
				lease sale annually in those areas of the reserve most likely to produce
				commercial quantities of oil and natural gas each year in the period 2013
				through
				2023.

text.#text: The

header.#text:
National
			 Petroleum Reserve in Alaska: planning and permitting pipeline and road
			 construction

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, in consultation with
			 other appropriate Federal agencies, shall facilitate and ensure permits, in a
			 timely and environmentally responsible manner, for all surface development
			 activities, including for the construction of pipelines and roads, necessary
			 to—

text.#text:
Notwithstanding any
			 other provision of law, the

develop and bring
			 into production any areas within the National Petroleum Reserve in Alaska that
			 are subject to oil and gas leases; and

transport oil and gas from and through the
			 National Petroleum Reserve in Alaska in the most direct manner possible to
			 existing transportation or processing infrastructure on the North Slope of
			 Alaska.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall ensure that any Federal
			 permitting agency shall issue permits in accordance with the following
			 timeline:

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
has issued a permit to drill
			 shall be approved within 60 days after the date of enactment of this
			 Act.

text.#text:
Permits for such construction for
			 transportation of oil and natural gas produced under existing Federal oil and
			 gas leases with respect to which the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
of a
			 request for a permit to drill.

text.#text:
Permits for such construction for
			 transportation of oil and natural gas produced under Federal oil and gas leases
			 shall be approved within 6 months after the submission to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall submit to

a plan for approved
			 rights-of-way for a plan for pipeline, road, and any other surface
			 infrastructure that may be necessary infrastructure that will ensure that all
			 leasable tracts in the Reserve are within 25 miles of an approved road and
			 pipeline right-of-way that can serve future development of the Reserve.

text.#text:
To ensure timely future development of the
			 Reserve, within 270 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the

header.#text:
Issuance of a new
			 integrated activity plan and environmental impact statement

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall, within 180 days after the date of enactment of
			 this Act, issue—

text.#text: The

header.#text:
Issuance of new
			 integrated activity plan

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
and dated February 21, 2013;
			 and

text.#text:
a
			 new proposed integrated activity plan from among the non-adopted alternatives
			 in the National Petroleum Reserve Alaska Integrated Activity Plan Record of
			 Decision issued by the

an environmental
			 impact statement under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
for issuance of oil and gas leases in the
			 National Petroleum Reserve-Alaska to promote efficient and maximum development
			 of oil and natural gas resources of such reserve.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 102(2)(C) of the National Environmental Policy
			 Act of 1969

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, the National Petroleum Reserve-Alaska Integrated Activity Plan
			 Record of Decision issued by the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Petroleum Reserve Alaska Access Act/s:5/ss:a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
and dated February
			 21, 2013, including the integrated activity plan and environmental impact
			 statement referred to in that record of decision, shall have no force or
			 effect.

text.#text: Except as provided in

header.#text:
Nullification of
			 existing record of decision, IAP, and EIS

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall issue
			 regulations not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act
			 that establish clear requirements to ensure that the

is supporting development of oil and gas leases in the National Petroleum
			 Reserve-Alaska.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Petroleum Reserve Alaska Access Act/s:5/ss:a/p:1

text.#text:
At a minimum, the new proposed integrated
			 activity plan issued under

header.#text:
Deadlines under
			 new proposed integrated activity plan

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
to respond within 5 business days to a person who
			 submits an application for a permit for development of oil and natural gas
			 leases in the National Petroleum Reserve-Alaska acknowledging receipt of such
			 application; and

text.#text: require the

establish a
			 timeline for the processing of each such application, that—

specifies
			 deadlines for decisions and actions on permit applications; and

provide that the
			 period for issuing each permit after submission of such an application shall
			 not exceed 60 days without the concurrence of the applicant.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall complete a
			 comprehensive assessment of all technically recoverable fossil fuel resources
			 within the National Petroleum Reserve in Alaska, including all conventional and
			 unconventional oil and natural gas.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall be carried out by the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Petroleum Reserve Alaska Access Act/s:8/ss:a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
in cooperation and
			 consultation with the State of Alaska and the American Association of Petroleum
			 Geologists.

text.#text: The resource assessment required by

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall be completed within 24
			 months of the date of the enactment of this Act.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Petroleum Reserve Alaska Access Act/s:8/ss:a

text.#text:
The
			 resource assessment required by

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may, in carrying out the duties under this
			 section, cooperatively use resources and funds provided by the State of
			 Alaska.
